At first glance, this place looked very nice. They hung a sign outside the entrance â€œBlue Fern Hotelâ€. Its a house. Not a hotel. Its location is nice...during the day. The hosts seemed nice when I asked them if this place would fit my needs. In that Iowa friendly way they assured me it would.
However, the reality of this listing is itâ€™s just a pretty picture. The hosts claimed it would accommodate myself and 2 teen sons and service dog. It did not.
The safety railing was not anchored into the wall when you enter the house. They used wood screws and just screwed it into the drywall. The futon had very little padding and several cross bars the made it impossible for anyone to sleep on.
The bedroom is up a few unguarded steps into a room with a very hard, full size bed and hard lumpy pillows. The bedroom is very small and the pitch of the roof is too close to the bed so that people hit their head getting in and out of bed. There are no windows in the bedroom which I discovered is illegal in Iowa.
The whole level of the main room is off and feels like youâ€™re walking in a funny house.
I came into town to care for my ailing mother and could only sleep there for 2 nights of a 10 day stay. My sons slept there the first 2 nights and complained of how uncomfortable it was and they are boy scouts used to roughing it.
I stayed the following 2 nights while my boys stayed with my parents and agreed. We found much better accommodations and canceled the rest of the stay.
When I made my complaint to airbnb and the hosts, the hosts offered to reimburse the whole stay and make the repairs and I regained respect for the hosts and planned on checking out their other listing in the lower level of the house for future stays and to recommend to friends coming up to visit over the summer.
Then the hosts blamed the builders for the hand railing and did not care that the stairs are so steeply pitched and shallow they are difficult for anyone to use. They clearly dont care about their guestâ€™s safety or comfort.
They became defensive saying no one else complained.
Even though the hosts offered to reimburse the whole stay, I was still charged. The only change they made to the place was to edit the occupancy listing from 3 to 2.
The photos of Ottumwa are heavily photoshopped. There are plenty of natural areas and bike riding trails to promote honestly without creative photography schemes to make Ottumwa look like something it is not.
